intro: Chrysanthemum coronarium subsp. discolor, commonly known as the white chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white ray florets and dark green, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional medicine. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced disc florets compared to other chrysanthemum species.
